page.title: 20SCHOOLS IN CARLTON
page.content: There are{3 Primary Schools}in Carlton,but no{Secondary}Schools or {Colleges.Kingston Junior School}was built in 1956.There are{9}teachers in that School.Miss Jones is the head teacher.The{School}is in Nottinghamshire.The{School}is{27 years {old.There are 242}children altogether in {9}classes.The{2}other{Schools}in Carlton are Ramsden Junior and Infant School.Ramsden Infant was built in 1831.Ramsden Junior was built in{1894 {Mr Jones is the present}headmaster but is not related to Miss Jones of Kingston school.The house where the old{headmaster}lived was joining South Carlton to North Carlton.{Ramsden } School was given its name because the Ramsden family gave the land to build it on.This{survey}was carried out by {Class 8 Woodsetts Junior School July {1985.
